head.title: 2 Boys, 10 and 15, Die in Separate Slayings

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: 2 Boys, 10 and 15, Die in Separate Slayings

abstract.p: Japhet Rojas, 10, is slain in his Bronx apartment; his brother, 12, is arrested after death is ruled homicide; gunman shoots boy, 15, to death after demanding money and jewelry, Brooklyn (M)

block.p: Two boys were slain yesterday -- one of them by his 12-year-old brother -- in unrelated incidents in the Bronx and Brooklyn, the police said.

The first slaying took place early yesterday, when Japhet Rojas, 10, was killed by his 12-year-old brother in an apartment at 2767 Morris Avenue in the Bedford Park section of the Bronx, the police said, adding that the victim was autistic.
Two boys were slain yesterday -- one of them by his 12-year-old brother -- in unrelated incidents in the Bronx and Brooklyn, the police said.

The first slaying took place early yesterday, when Japhet Rojas, 10, was killed by his 12-year-old brother in an apartment at 2767 Morris Avenue in the Bedford Park section of the Bronx, the police said, adding that the victim was autistic.
''It's unclear at this point what the cause of death was,'' said Detective Joseph Pentangelo, a police spokesman.
Although the medical examiner's office ruled the incident a homicide yesterday afternoon, the police did not have further details, he said.
The victim's brother was arrested and charged with homicide, Detective Pentangelo said.
Japhet's body was discovered yesterday morning in his bed by his sister, who called the police around 6:30 a.m., the police said.
After the incident was ruled a homicide, police officers arrested the 12-year-old, whose name was withheld by the police.

The second killing took place around 2:20 p.m. outside 720 Elderts Lane in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, when a gunman, 16, shot a 15-year-old youth in the chest after demanding money and jewelry, the police said.
Emergency workers arrived minutes later and took the victim to Brookdale Hospital, where he died shortly afterward, Detective Pentangelo said.
The police were still searching for the gunman last night. They did not release the victim's name because his family had not been notified.
